newsitem.title: ESTONIA: BALTIKA EQUITY INCREASES BY 18.5 MLN.
newsitem.headline: BALTIKA EQUITY INCREASES BY 18.5 MLN.

text.p: The equity of Estonian clothing company Baltika will be increased by 18.5 million kroons after a closed share issue, Hansa Investments said on Friday.
Baltika issued 7,725 new shares at a price of 2,400 kroons, 12 times higher from the nominal value of the stock.
"The subscribers were Estonian and foreign investors," Piret Raudsepp from Hansa Investments told Reuters.
The institutional investors' stake in the share capital increased with the closed issue, which is good for getting the company listed on the stock exchange, she added.
"The company will get a listing during May," she said.
Baltika made a net profit of 13.4 million kroons last year and its estimate for this year is 15.8 million kroons.
